text:
This old-school breakfast spot in Kallang offers a delicious and affordable meal, perfect for early risers. For just $3, you get freshly fried and tasty items, each well-presented, showing the pride the stall takes in their food. Despite its popularity with the locals, thereâ€™s no crowd, making it a hidden gem for those who know where to look. A great find for anyone in search of a simple, satisfying start to the day!
Do note that only cash transaction.

Came here after a long break from lunching here and man it was awesome, I chose this stall as their nasi lemak looks good and price is very affordable, the stall owner was also very friendly and accommodating. I ordered fish fillet nasi lemak but was surprised to be given free chicken too without any additional cost. I told that I would definitely come back here again for lunch.
Reasonably priced and delicious Nasi lemak - rice is really fragrant with the lemak taste and ingredients complement the dish. Old school coffee shop is a nice escape from the busyness of the city.

Tucked away in a secluded Food Centre near Kallang area, this stall served good authentic and traditional Nasi Lemak. Their freshly fried chicken wings are super addictive. Coupled with their fluffy coconut infused rice, egg and crunch anchovies, their Nasi Lemak is one of the delicious I have ever tasted. Their Nasi Lemak set is priced at $3.00 each, which is very affordable and is a deal that you shouldn't miss.
Old school hawker centre. Not for Gen Y and Z. Perfect for me. Nasi lemak with chicken wing only $3.50. crispy and nice too, in this setting. 5 star.
